security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill providing test execution guidance. No executable code, network calls, or filesystem access. Contains only shell command documentation for running tests.

content.value_statement: Running tests manually requires memorizing Bun test commands and environment variables. This skill provides standardized test execution with coverage reporting and integration test workflows for the Catalyst-Relay SAP ADT bridge library.
actual_capabilities: Run all unit tests with Bun test runner
Execute tests in watch mode for development
Verify Node.js compatibility with type stripping
Execute SAP integration tests with credentials
Display test coverage map by module
limitations: Requires Bun runtime to be installed
Integration tests require valid SAP credentials
Cannot modify test files or add new tests
Environment variables must be set externally

faq.question: What runtime is required to run tests?
faq.answer: Bun runtime is required for running tests. Install via bun install if not already available.

faq.question: How do I run integration tests?
faq.answer: Set SAP credentials in environment variables, then run ./test.bat with the SAP password argument.

faq.question: Can I run tests for a single module?
faq.answer: Yes, specify the directory path after bun test command, for example: bun test src/__tests__/core

faq.question: Is my SAP data safe during tests?
faq.answer: Tests use a dedicated test environment. No production data is modified. Integration tests run on configured test systems only.

faq.question: Why do I need to verify Node.js compatibility?
faq.answer: Catalyst-Relay targets both Bun and Node.js. The experimental-strip-types flag verifies library imports work in Node.

faq.question: How is this different from other testing skills?
faq.answer: This skill is specialized for Catalyst-Relay with built-in knowledge of test structure, coverage maps, and SAP integration workflows.
